gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.worldfile

Class WorldFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.worldwind.formats.worldfile.WorldFile

  • public class WorldFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Static methods to handle world files typically distributed with georeferenced rasters.
    Version:
    $Id: WorldFile.java 1171 2013-02-11 21:45:02Z dcollins $
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • getWorldFiles

        public static java.io.File[] getWorldFiles(java.io.File dataFile)
                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Retrieve the metadata files corresponding to a specified image or elevation file.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - the image or elevation file for which to retrieve the metadata files.
        Returns:
        the metadata files that exist in the same directory as the data file, otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the data file is null.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the data file does not exist.

      • decodeWorldFiles

        public static AVList decodeWorldFiles(java.io.File[] worldFiles,
                                      AVList values)
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Retrieves the useful values from a collection of world files.
        Parameters:
        worldFiles - the world files.
        values - may contain a buffered image, needed to retrieve image size
        Returns:
        an attribute-value list containing the values from the world files.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file is null.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file cannot be parsed as a world file.

      • decodeWorldFile

        public static double[] decodeWorldFile(java.io.File worldFile)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Retrieves the six lines from a world file.
        Parameters:
        worldFile - the world file.
        Returns:
        an array containing the six values in the order they are found in the world file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file is null.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file cannot be parsed as a world file.

      • worldFileValuesAppearGeographic

        public static boolean worldFileValuesAppearGeographic(AVList values)
        Indicates whether world file values appear to be in latitude and longitude.
        Parameters:
        values - the six values to examine.
        Returns:
        true if the values are between the normal limits of latitude, [-90, 90], and longitude, [-180, 180], othewise false.

      • parseDegrees

        public static Sector parseDegrees(AVList values,
                                  int imageWidth,
                                  int imageHeight)
        Decodes the six values of a world file in the lat/lon coordinate system to a Sector. The rotation values are ignored.
        Parameters:
        values - the values to parse
        imageWidth - the width of the image associated with the world file.
        imageHeight - the height of the image associated with the world file.
        Returns:
        a sector computed from the world file values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the values array is null or has a length less than six, or the image width and height are less than zero.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the decoded values are not within the normal range of latituded and longitude.
        See Also:
        worldFileValuesAppearGeographic(gov.nasa.worldwind.avlist.AVList)

      • parseUTM

        public static Sector parseUTM(double[] values,
                              int imageWidth,
                              int imageHeight,
                              int zone,
                              java.lang.String hemisphere)
        Compute a Sector from UTM world file values.
        Parameters:
        values - the six values from the world file.
        imageWidth - the width of the image associated with the world file.
        imageHeight - the height of the image associated with the world file.
        zone - the UTM zone number (1 to 60), can be zero if expected units are in decimal degrees.
        hemisphere - the UTM hemisphere, either AVKey.NORTH or AVKey.SOUTH.
        Returns:
        the corresponding Sector or null if the sector could not be computed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the values array is null or has a length less than six, , the image width and height are less than zero, or the hemisphere indicator is not AVKey.NORTH or AVKey.SOUTH
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the decoded values are not within the normal range of latituded and longitude.
        See Also:
        worldFileValuesAppearGeographic(gov.nasa.worldwind.avlist.AVList)

      • decodeOGCCoordinateSystemWKT

        public static AVList decodeOGCCoordinateSystemWKT(java.lang.String text,
                                                  AVList params)
        Retrieves the coordinate system and its parameters from an OGC coordinate system encoded as well-known text. For details, see to the OGC Coordinate Transform Service (CT) specification at http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/ct. This recognizes Geographic and UTM coordinate systems. This configures the parameter list according to the coordinate system as follows:
        • Geographic - AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM set to AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM_GEOGRAPHIC.
        • Projected coordinate system: Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) - AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM set to AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM_PROJECTED and AVKey.PROJECTION_NAME set to AVKey.PROJECTION_UTM. AVKey.PROJECTION_HEMISPHERE set to either AVKey.NORTH or AVKey.SOUTH. AVKey.PROJECTION_ZONE set to an integer in the range 1-60
        • Projected coordinate system: unknown projection - AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM set to AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM_PROJECTED and AVKey.PROJECTION_NAME set to AVKey.PROJECTION_UNKNOWN.
        • Unknown coordinate system - AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM set to AVKey.COORDINATE_SYSTEM_UNKNOWN.
        If an exception occurs while parsing the coordinate system text, the parameter list is left unchanged.
        Parameters:
        text - a String containing an OGC coordinate system in well-known text format.
        params - the coordinate system parameter list, or null to indicate a parameter list should be created.
        Returns:
        the coordinate system parameter list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if text is null.

      • hasWorldFiles

        public static boolean hasWorldFiles(java.lang.Object source)
        Checks if the source is accompanied by any world file

        The source type may be one of the following:

        • URL
        • URI
        • File
        • String containing a valid URL description, a valid URI description, or a valid path to a local file.
        Parameters:
        source - the source to local file path.
        Returns:
        TRUE if there is a world file for the source, otherwise returns FALSE

      • readWorldFiles

        public static void readWorldFiles(java.lang.Object source,
                                  AVList params)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads and decodes world file for the source

        The source type may be one of the following:

        • URL
        • URI
        • File
        • String containing a valid URL description, a valid URI description, or a valid path to a local file.
        Parameters:
        source - the source to local file path.
        params - AVList for storing parameters
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the world file could not be read
